name: pattern-links
description: Automatically turn text into links based upon regex patterns.

linkPattern.markdownDescription:
A regular expression used to find text in the document to turn into links.

Example: `ISSUES-\d+`

The example pattern would match text like `ISSUE-1` and `ISSUE-200`.

linkPatternFlags.markdownDescription:
A list of [regular expression flags](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular_Expressions#advanced_searching_with_flags) to use.

Example: `is`

The example flags make the search case-insensitive (`i` flag) and allows the `.` character to match over multiple lines (`s` flag). The `g` flag is always applied.

linkTarget.markdownDescription:
The link template.

Example: `https://myorg.atlassian.net/browse/$0`

In the example, `$0` will be replaced with the captured text from the linkPattern; the final URL might be `https://myorg.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUE-200`.

languages.markdownDescription:
An array of languages to enable this rule for.

Example: `["plaintext", "markdown"]`

If no languages are specified, the rule is enabled for all languages.

patternlinks.rules.markdownDescription: A list of rules for turning text into clickable links.

scripts.tests: pnpm clean:out:tests && pnpm tests:compile && pnpm tests:run
scripts.prepack: pnpm run package:size && pnpm run package:list
